Body:
Description: Hi Team,

I'm creating current ticket on behalf of Klarna team that is currently in the process of removing the EPP client from their computers. They reached out to me with the following question: 
Is there a script you guys have that can be used to force remove without the password requirement since the server will be terminated soon?

Klarna has the EPP client installed on Windows and macOS computers and the license is already expired. Furthermore, multiple computers may be offline at the moment so a Client Uninstall action with an active license will not cover such cases.

Let us know if other details would be needed.

Thank you,

Oana Nemes | Team Lead, Customer Success
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

Please make sure to add following email addresses when replying:

akhil.babel@klarna.com

oana.nemes@netwrix.com

Next Steps Updated: For Windows customer can use the Zaptool "EppServicesZap64.zip", they can execute this tool and it will remove the EPP client and all traces of it.  They need to allow at least 1 full minute to run.
For macOS they can use the script "remove-epp_nopwd_13_01_2022.command.zip", they will need to run this script with sudo privileges.

What We've Learned Updated: Our customer Klarna is currently in the process of removing the EPP client from their computers. They reached out to us with the following question:
Is there a script you guys have that can be used to force remove without the password requirement since the server will be terminated soon?

Klarna has the EPP client installed on Windows and macOS computers and the license is already expired. Furthermore, multiple computers may be offline at the moment so a Client Uninstall action with an active license will not cover such cases.

They also will need to uninstall from devices that are NOT currently online, and may not be online till the server stays on live, i.e, may not get the updated uninstall password.  Both Windows and macOS.
